nice first person slideshow horror adventure really good oppressive and gloomy atmosphere some of the puzzles could be kind of convoluted but its an ok game and a cult classic adventure in the horror genre
not my main game type so went with very poor expectations and got suprised is quite interesting

the graphics look good even now  the plot is interesting but there are enough unrevealed details spoiler is james alive or dead jerry says hes dead but the bank account is open who was feeding robin raw meat in the basement who killed james wife him or his son was it intentional or accidental spoiler   additional pluses only one jump scare in the entire game and all the dialogue is voiced

an essential game to play if youre a fan of more slowburn horror no overthetop opening or heavyhanded jumpscares just puzzles and a gradually increasing sense of dread i have been chasing the feeling from this game and been disappointed by many other horror games since
it is a good old horror game

i am a huge fan of horror games movies and stories it is my favourite genre for shame because of it it gets harder and harder to get that sweet thrilling sensation but scratches is one of the games which managed to shake me story rich mysterious and unsettling  everything i could wish for controls might be a little annoying at first and the gameplay is generally quite simple but scratches is about the atmosphere i fell in love with it and i would certainly recommend it
atmosphere and music were great premise is cool but the plot developments and most importantly the puzzles fell flat did not scratch the myst itch

it is creepy so searching for too long induced anxiety sparing use of a guide is recommended if it gets too much to handle besides i remember a small mirror in a bedroom could only be interacted with after the character discovers how it could be useful so without a guide i would not have realised i had to go back for it

i really wanted more of this it was a simple horror story told with a pointandclick play style and a very satisfying yet harrowing ending i really really liked this game its one of the few games whichs plot i still remember without looking it up
best point and click game ive ever played only one ive ever finished to be fair the story kept me interested throughout

exceptional atmosphere especially considering the age of the game it does have a bit of a difficult learning curve as it doesnt do much to prompt you on where you need to go but ive played for just shy of four hours now and am very intrigued thus far

dont be turned off by the 90s myst7th guest way this game plays  ive play lots and lots of horror games over the years and this one is on the short list  i cant say exactly why but this is a game i think about often  i really enjoyed it  dont let the technical limitations turn you off

this is a carefully crafted story with layers of mystery and as you a mystery writer discover more about the house and its past residents you cant walk away from the fear and revulsion without knowing why there were murders and indeed who died  and of course there are the scratches

its a rather simple pointandclick horror game with puzzles but what really got to me was the atmosphere there were moments where i jumped or felt that sense of dread as the game progressed the only down side to this was the added epilogue portion of the game its not very long but i felt that it ruined the atmosphere and was rather cheesy so personally i would just stick with playing the main game and ignoring the epilogue you wont miss out on anything if you do
the first point and click game i ever played the game has a lot of charm i love the horror writers perspective
great

the game has a great atmospheric soundtrack as you play and an opening premise that gets your imagination pulsing with tension but ultimately the game falls flat on its face this is the sort of game that gates your progress through the story with a chore checklist rather clever puzzles
the journey is good but the ending well see for yourself

scratches is a wonderful classic of the point and click horror genre amazing atmosphere great puzzles and stellar audio design always leaves you wanting more from it especially if youre stuck on a puzzle great to see it coming back on steam again

tags adventure  wc  walk clicker additional tags delete local content  remove from library  tldr ancestor to horror walking simulators move confusingly between stillshots around a manor to open locked doors and solve simple yet frustrating puzzles walkthrough required outdated

genuinely one of the scariest horror games ive played and ive played a lot of them  its a true testament to the skill of the developers that a point and click game with zero jump scares can scare you so much more than any aaa horror game out there just by slowly and gradually building a crushingly haunting atmosphere  1010 its a must play for any horror fan
great game

one of the best horror games ive ever played  even though the graphics are oldschool they are stylized in a way that will spook and interest you at the same time  while the sound effects contribute to the eerie feeling  definitely worth playing if only for the atmosphere alone
great game

this game is great scary good puzzles atmospheric
incredible atmosphere compelling story wrapped in foreboding and terror  even the fussy interface and the sometimes absurd puzzle solutions arent enough to tarnish this gem

simplistic in the sense that it is a point and click puzzle adventure game  cellar of rats developed the music for this and i think that is what really makes it such a terrifying game  this game is the only one where i have fallen out of my chair  but it is not about jumps like many main stream games utilize  it is the ambience  darm rooms creepy dolls and such sinister music and ambience  on a different note the voice acting could be morehmmm natural i guess

another first impression  tedious and awkward even for a point  click game  the music score and seemlingly authetic sounds from opening doors and creeking of the floor as your character walks through the house is the only thing this game has going for it

the music sound and visuals are all nice  however the seemingly out of the blue puzzles and hard to find tiny items make it a hard game to like  i spent more time looking at the walkthrough than i did the game
good story  nice environment  variation of places   crazy mouse  hard to find the objects  not so much hint  confusing
this game scared the hell out of me an amazing game with a gripping story which makes you feel thankful that you dont have to live in a decrepit old house
not worth your time it is too slow and no atmosphere there

fun quick old school horror adventure game

unbelievably boring game no free movement at all would be half decent if there was more depth and freedom

it was an interesting experience im not that familiar with the point  click adventures not quite as scary as i was hoping for but it did have a few moments where i was on edge kind of an openended ending and i needed to result to a guide once or twice but that could be more due to my unfamiliarity with the genre than anything on their end
a deep intriguing plot with great sound effectsmusic the atmosphere feels chilling and the story thickens with every clue

a pretty decent and challenging point and click game  doesnt give you a lot of direction except for a few hints along the way  it has sort of a creepy and uneasy thing going on throughout the game  if you like point and click games you should check this out  for those wondering this isnt a horror game with jump scaresthere are a couple parts that are a little creepy but not monsters chasing you and jumping out at you

i recommend this game if you are a fan of adventure games if you are a newcomer to adventure games looking to start this probably isnt the place scratches is a short game about 6 hours about an author who has just moved into an old mansion upon moving in he doesnt know the history behind it but quickly discovers there is a mystery to be solved if you are looking for a mystery to solve than this is the game for you

another great game ive played this one right after dark fall lost souls its a great point n click adventure set in an isolated manor in the middle of nowhere the atmosphere is very creepy and claustophobic and the game play is simple and easy the riddles are not very difficult since they mostly consist of combining items the story is spoiler alert a typical cursed artifact adventure not very innovative but its good i recommend this game to everyone

a pointandclick game that offers some good puzzlesolving moments and a few scares the story and creepy visuals are immersive enough that you feel nervous moving around blackwood house i advise getting this game on a good sale because it does offer only a few hours of gameplay replayvalue is quite low but this makes a super bargain game to have in your horror collection
